column4: How would I go about installing an older kernel for intrepid ibex with no internet working (on the machine I want to install it on)?
Get the package, put it on a [flash drive, CD, floppy, tape], plug into machine, install with sudo dpkg -i <file>
You can find the packages on http://packages.ubuntu.com/intrepid/
You probably won't need the kernel headers.
I need to compile ndiswrapper and install it
Then you might need it. Out of pure interest, what's your wifi card?
I see. http://packages.ubuntu.com/intrepid/base/linux-image-2.6.27-7-generic <-- package is here, btw
I need an older one
Oh. Try looking in dapper, then :P
I'm a pentium d, am I 386 or 686......686, right?
Yeah
should I already have initrd-tools installed?
Well, since every kernel depends on them, yes, they should be installed.
running into problem with modutils
the current kernel uses module-init-tools, whereas I need modutils for a previous kernel
Uh, I don't know. Can't you just install modutils?
no, they conflict
module-init-tools is supposed to replace modutils
Hm... I assume removing module-init-tools would create major breakage?
I tried, it looked like it
Then I have no idea, sorry :|
but it shouldn't matter to me If I'm able to install the old kernel
I'm gonna do it and I'll see what happens :)
Good luck
